skills.name: Follow simple directions to translate a shape or object using words not vectors
Describe simple directions to translate a shape or object using words not vectors

explanations.A: I think you have moved 3 squares up and 1 square right. Read the question carefully
explanations.B: I think you have mixed up your right and left. Right will take us over towards the written part of the question
explanations.C: Start on the star. Move one square to the right (to the next cross in the lines) then another square along, then another square along. You will now be directly below the letter C. We are then told to move one square up. So one jump up takes us on to the letter C
explanations.D: You have moved 1 square up, but not quite 3 squares right. Count the jumps carefully, going from one cross in the lines to the next

explanations.A: Start on the star. Move 1 square to the right (to the next cross in the lines). You will now be directly below the letters A and D. We are then told to move 3 squares up. 3 jumps up take us on to the letter A
explanations.B: I think you have mixed up your right and left. Right will take us over towards the written part of the question
explanations.C: I think you have moved 3 squares right and 1 square up. Read the question carefully
explanations.D: You have moved 1 square right, but not quite 3 squares up. Count the jumps carefully, going from one cross in the lines to the next

explanations.A: I think you have mixed up your right and left. Left will take us over towards the y axis
explanations.B: Start on the star. Move one square to the left (to the next cross in the lines) then another square along. You will now be directly above the letters C and B. We are then told to move 3 squares down. 3 jumps take us down on to the letter B
explanations.C: You have moved 2 squares left, but not quite 3 squares down. Count the jumps carefully, going from one cross in the lines to the next
explanations.D: You have moved 3 squares left and 2 squares down. Read the question carefully

explanations.A: I think you have mixed up your right and left. Left will take us over towards the y axis
explanations.B: You have moved 2 squares left and 3 squares down. Read the question carefully
explanations.C: You have moved 2 squares left and 2 squares down. Read the question carefully
explanations.D: Start on the star. Move one square to the left (to the next cross in the lines) then another square along, and another. You will now be directly above the letter D. We are then told to move 2 squares down. 2 jumps down take us on to the letter D

explanations.A: Start in the middle of the star. We have to make 3 jumps to the right, making sure we move from one cross in the lines to the next cross in the lines. Then we need to make 2 jumps up in order to reach the middle of the triangle.
explanations.B: I think you have counted the number of crosses between squares, rather than the number of jumps needed.
explanations.C: I think you have miscounted how far up we need to jump. We will need to get from the middle of the star to the middle of the triangle
explanations.D: I think you have mixed up the directions. Think carefully about which direction is right (towards the answers) and which direction is up (towards the top of the page)

explanations.A: I think you have mixed up the directions. Think carefully about which direction is right (towards the answers) and which direction is up (towards the top of the page)
explanations.B: I think you have counted the number of crosses between squares, rather than the number of jumps needed.
explanations.C: I think you have miscounted how far up we need to jump. We will need to get from the middle of the star to the middle of the triangle
explanations.D: Start in the middle of the star. We have to make 2 jumps to the right, making sure we move from one cross in the lines to the next cross in the lines. Then we need to make 3 jumps up in order to reach the middle of the triangle.

explanations.A: You have described how to get from the triangle to the star. Read the question carefully!
explanations.B: I think you have mixed up the directions. Think carefully about which direction is right (towards the answers) and which direction is down (towards the bottom of the page)
explanations.C: I think you have miscounted how far down we need to jump. We will need to get from the middle of the star to the middle of the triangle
explanations.D: Start in the middle of the star. We have to make 1 jump to the right, making sure we move from one cross in the lines to the next cross in the lines. Then we need to make 3 jumps down in order to reach the middle of the triangle.

explanations.A: You have described how to get from the triangle to the star. Read the question carefully!
explanations.B: Start in the middle of the star. We have to make 3 jumps to the right, making sure we move from one cross in the lines to the next cross in the lines. Then we need to make 1 jump down in order to reach the middle of the triangle.
explanations.C: I think you have counted the number of crosses between squares, rather than the number of jumps needed.
explanations.D: I think you have mixed up the directions. Think carefully about which direction is right (towards the answers) and which direction is down (towards the bottom of the page)

explanations.A: I think you have counted the number of crosses between squares, rather than the number of jumps needed.
explanations.B: Start in the middle of the star. We have to make 1 jump up, making sure we move from one cross in the lines to the next cross in the lines. Then we need to make 4 jumps left in order to reach the middle of the triangle.
explanations.C: You have described how to get from the triangle to the star. Read the question carefully!
explanations.D: Make sure you are going from the star to the triangle and count the number of jumps needed rather than the number of crosses between squares.

explanations.A: I think you have counted the number of crosses between squares, rather than the number of jumps needed.
explanations.B: You have described how to get from the triangle to the star. Read the question carefully!
explanations.C: I think you have counted the number of crosses between squares, rather than the number of jumps needed.
explanations.D: Start in the middle of the star. We have to make 1 jump left, making sure we move from one cross in the lines to the next cross in the lines. Then we need to make 4 jumps up in order to reach the middle of the triangle.
